message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.MM, cs.CE

Reasoning: 
1. cs.IT (Information Theory): The paper proposes a new relaying protocol with adaptive link selection and analyzes the corresponding throughput and power allocation. This falls under the scope of information theory.
2. cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture): The paper considers a simple network with a source, relay, and destination, and proposes a new relaying protocol. This falls under the scope of networking and internet architecture.
3. cs.SY (Systems and Control): The paper proposes a modified link selection protocol to avoid buffer overflow and characterizes the optimal link selection policy. This falls under the scope of systems and control.
4. cs.MM (Multimedia): The paper discusses delay-constrained and delay-unconstrained transmission and proposes a method to limit the queue size to avoid buffer overflow. This falls under the scope of multimedia.
5. cs.CE (Computational Engineering, Finance, and Science): The paper develops an optimal power allocation scheme for the proposed relaying protocol. This falls under the scope of computational engineering.
